com.google.appinventor.client.editor.simple.components

Class MockContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
        • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
          • com.google.appinventor.client.editor.simple.components.MockComponent
            • com.google.appinventor.client.editor.simple.components.MockVisibleComponent
              • com.google.appinventor.client.editor.simple.components.MockContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DragSource, DropTarget, PropertyChangeListener, HasAttachHandlers, HasHandlers, EventListener, HasVisibility, IsRenderable, IsWidget, SourcesMouseEvents
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockCanvas, MockForm, MockHVArrangement, MockTableArrangement

    public abstract class MockContainer
extends MockVisibleComponent
implements DropTarget
    Abstract superclass for all container mock components.
    Author:
    lizlooney@google.com (Liz Looney)

    • Field Detail

      • layout

        protected final com.google.appinventor.client.editor.simple.components.MockLayout layout

      • children

        protected final List<MockComponent> children

      • rootPanel

        protected final AbsolutePanel rootPanel
        Directly contains the widgets corresponding to children MockComponents.

        This should not be modified directly by implementations; use addComponent(com.google.appinventor.client.editor.simple.components.MockComponent) and removeComponent(com.google.appinventor.client.editor.simple.components.MockComponent, boolean) to make modifications.

        This is a GWT absolute panel so that the MockLayout associated with this container can freely position and size children widgets as desired.

    • Method Detail

      • getChildren

        public List<MockComponent> getChildren()
        Description copied from class: MockComponent
        Returns the children of this component. Note that the return value will never be null but rather an empty array for components without children.

        The returned list should not be modified.

        Overrides:
        getChildren in class MockComponent
        Returns:
        children of the component

      • getPreferredWidth

        public int getPreferredWidth()
        Description copied from class: MockComponent
        Returns the preferred width of the component if there was no layout restriction, including the CSS border.

        Callers should be aware that most components cannot calculate their preferred size correctly until they are attached to the UI; see Composite.isAttached(). Unattached components are liable to return 0 for any query about their preferred size.

        Overrides:
        getPreferredWidth in class MockComponent
        Returns:
        preferred width

        Callers should be aware that most components cannot calculate their preferred size correctly until they are attached to the UI; see Composite.isAttached(). Unattached components are liable to return 0 for any query about their preferred size.

        Overrides:

      • collectTypesAndIcons

        public void collectTypesAndIcons(Map<String,String> typesAndIcons)
        Description copied from class: MockComponent
        If this component isn't a Form, and this component's type isn't already in typesAndIcons, adds this component's type name as a key to typesAndIcons, mapped to the HTML string used to display the component type's icon. Subclasses that contain components should override this to add their own info as well as that for their contained components.
        Overrides:
        collectTypesAndIcons in class MockComponent

      • addComponent

        public final void addComponent(MockComponent component)
        Adds a new component to the end of this container.
        Parameters:
        component - component to be added

      • addVisibleComponent

        public final void addVisibleComponent(MockComponent component,
                       int beforeVisibleIndex)
        Adds a new visible component to the container at the specified visible-index.
        Parameters:
        component - visible component to be added
        beforeVisibleIndex - visible-index at which the inserted component will appear, or -1 to insert the component at the end

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent(MockComponent component,
                   boolean permanentlyDeleted)
        Removes a component from the container (assumes that component is a child component of the container). If the component itself contains other components, we first ask for confirmation.
        Parameters:
        component - component to be removed
        permanentlyDeleted - true if the component is being permanently deleted, false if the component is being moved from one container to another container

      • getDropTargetWidget

        public final Widget getDropTargetWidget()
        Description copied from interface: DropTarget
        Returns the GWT component associated with this DropTarget. The location of this widget is used to determine the bounds of the drop region.

        This method may be called frequently.

        Specified by:
        getDropTargetWidget in interface DropTarget
        Returns:
        widget

      • acceptableSource

        protected boolean acceptableSource(DragSource source)
        Indicates whether a component from the given source can be placed in this container.
        Parameters:
        source -
        Returns:
        true if the component is acceptable, false otherwise

      • onDragEnter

        public final boolean onDragEnter(DragSource source,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Description copied from interface: DropTarget
        Invoked when a drag source that is currently being dragged enters the bounds of this target's widget.

        Returns true if the drag source is accepted, false otherwise.

        If this method accepts that drag, it is guaranteed that DropTarget.onDragContinue(DragSource, int, int) will be invoked immediately afterwards with the same x and y arguments.

        Specified by:
        onDragEnter in interface DropTarget
        Parameters:
        source - the drag source that is hovering over this drop target's widget
        x - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
        y - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
        Returns:
        true if the source is accepted, false otherwise

      • onDragContinue

        public final void onDragContinue(DragSource source,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Description copied from interface: DropTarget
        Invoked while an accepted drag source is being dragged over this target's widget.

        It is guaranteed that:

        1. this method will be invoked immediately after an invocation of DropTarget.onDragEnter(DragSource, int, int) that accepts its drag source
        2. this method will be invoked immediately before an invocation of DropTarget.onDrop(DragSource, int, int, int, int)
        Specified by:
        onDragContinue in interface DropTarget
        Parameters:
        source - the accepted drag source that is hovering over this drop target's widget
        x - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
        y - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget

      • onDragLeave

        public final void onDragLeave(DragSource source)
        Description copied from interface: DropTarget
        Invoked while an accepted drag source has been dragged outside the bounds of this target's widget.
        Specified by:
        onDragLeave in interface DropTarget
        Parameters:
        source - the accepted drag source that is hovering over this drop target's widget

      • onDrop

        public final void onDrop(DragSource source,
          int x,
          int y,
          int offsetX,
          int offsetY)
        Description copied from interface: DropTarget
        Invoked when the user drops an accepted drag source on this target's widget.

        It is guaranteed that DropTarget.onDragContinue(DragSource, int, int) will have been invoked immediately beforehand with the same x and y arguments.

        Specified by:
        onDrop in interface DropTarget
        Parameters:
        source - the accepted drag source that has been dropped on this drop target's widget
        x - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
        y - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of this drop target's widget
        offsetX - the x-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of the drag-widget
        offsetY - the y-coordinate of the cursor, relative to the top-left corner of the drag-widget
